title: 26 Pizzerias For Delicious Non-Chicago-Style Thin Crusts
text:
Mar 21, 2017, 12:17pm CDT Spacca Napoli Spacca Napoli 
There's more to Chicago's pizza scene than tavern-style and deep-dish. Much like the diversity of the diners that reside in Chicago, Chicago's pizza scene expands beyond the norm. For many, authentic Chicago-style pizza begins with a thin crust that is cut into squares and served with the common man's beer: The tavern-style pizza. Others swear by deep dish—what Chicago is known for by many tourists and travelers alike. 
Perhaps you don't want to pick a side or a style, as Chicago features types of thin crusts based on several regional pie styles. Dive into New Haven, Conn.-style pies at Piece Pizza. Or perhaps a rustic Neapolitan-style from Spacca Napoli is more geared toward your tastes. And don't forget to wash that crust down with a great craft brews. Whether it's tossed, rolled or baked in a clay or wood-fired oven—there's something for everyone who loves pizza. Listed in alphabetical order. Please leave any suggestions or omissions in the comments. 1 Balena 
Some of the best hearth-fired pizza in Chicago is available at Balena in Lincoln Park. What exactly is hearth-fired pizza? It is pizza baked at an intense heat within a brick or stone-lined fireplace. Acclaimed chef Chris Pandel has created pizzas with a variety of toppings from artichoke to clams to pepperoni to mushrooms.
